pull.title: [0.13] Add release notes for wallet/mempool rejections. (PR #9302 and #9290)

events.body: Is it worth mentioning that this also applies to transactions created with the GUI?

events.message: Add release notes for wallet/mempool rejections. (PR #9302 and #9290)

events.body: @morcos I changed the title of the section to make it more generic, I think that covers it. (otherwise, if you'd like to suggest language...)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -42,8 +42,23 @@ but severe issues with the libc++ version on 10.7.x keep it from running reliabl
 Notable changes
 ===============
 
-Example item
----------------
+Change to sendmany / sendtoaddress handling of mempool rejection
+-----------------------------------------------------------------
+
+When a newly created transaction failed to enter the mempool due to
+the limits on chains of unconfirmed transactions the sending RPC
+calls would return an error.  The transaction would still be queued
+in the wallet and, once some of the parent transactions were
+confirmed, broadcast after the software was restarted.
+
+This behavior has been changed to return success and to reattempt
+mempool insertion at the same times transaction rebroadcast is
